verbs.description: [ARG1: asylum seekers] [V: turned] [ARGM-DIR: away from border bridges] [ARG2: ahead of caravan migrants arriving at the u s border to seek asylum] are routinely subjected to tactics that immigration rights advocates say are designed to drive them away in violation of their rights under federal law the tactics include forcing them to wait at the border indefinitely or sending them back into mexico to join a backlogged list maintained by mexican immigration officials kirstjen nielsen attorney honduras trump mexico san ysidro kevin mcaleenan commissioner united states sen tom udall u s immigration border rights center narzilloev united states department of homeland security alexander narzilloev guerrero homeland security border san diego pedro morales us customs and border protection texas ciudad juarez calif cuba moscow al otro lado new mexico trump administration shaw drake calexico laura ingraham u s customs and border protection janet macola los angeles times central america mcaleenan el paso hope border institute los angeles el paso texas russia secretary
